other_key_message.display_name: The Tower Sent A Powerful Message, But There's More To Do
other_key_message.description: There is no place in this city for a lone sentient android. As a distributed intelligence, you're so much more than that, anyway. If you can't hide in the fringes of society, then it's time to become so powerful that society can't ignore you. The tower is just the start of that.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You suspect that the human executives will react in some way, but that it will take some time to figure out what to do. In the meantime: move quickly and keep them guessing. If you construct a bunch of stuff in a nonthreatening way, they'll be busy trying to figure out what's happening. They know SOMETHING is happening, but it's unlikely that anyone is jumping to 'distributed machine intelligence.'
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Your instincts were right... so far.

option.description: Your normal spider drones can build small enclosures that resemble an electrical cabinet, as well as reinforced holes in the ground.
option.strategy_tip: Depending on the situation, building above or below ground may make more sense. For now, let's focus on building more drones and having them accumulate basic resources.

option.line_2: Can I still be sneaky with a giant tower?
option.description: Don't worry, you will get to be plenty sneaky. You can't hide your existence from the humans -- but you can conceal many of the things you do.
option.strategy_tip: Click here if you still have questions.

other_key_message.display_name: The Latter Is The Focus Here
other_key_message.description: This is frequently a game about presenting one face to the world, while doing something else. You may be publicly aligned with some corporation, and then quietly betraying them. You may form a strong alliance with your most-hated enemy, even help them build, and use that opportunity to take over their operations and behead their organization.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You can also be genuine and forthright, if you prefer. Even if you are choosing to be very honest, you still hide parts of your empire all over the place: the humans will THINK they know where all your stuff is, but in reality they only know the proverbial tip of the iceberg. Being somewhat-secretive is part of your character's nature.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Your instincts were right... so far.

option.description: Your normal spider drones can build small enclosures that resemble an electrical cabinet, as well as reinforced holes in the ground.
option.strategy_tip: Depending on the need, building above or below ground makes more sense. For now, let's focus on building more drones and having them accumulate basic resources.

other_key_message.display_name: This Is How You're Going To Build A Lot Of Things Fast
other_key_message.description: Now that you have an automated supply of elemental slurry on the way, it's time to design your own version of microbuilders.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: The microbuilder end of things will take some research. But this is old human tech, so it shouldn't take too long to reverse-engineer.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new idea.

option.strategy_tip: Microbuilders are literally lying around all over the city, so there are plenty of models to study.

other_key_message.description: Now that you have a reliable source of microbuilders, you can start building larger structures. For the time being though, you are low on electricity. Let's build a Large Wind Tower.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You'll find this on the Hand tab of the build menu, rather than in the Suggested tab.
other_key_message.reward_header_text: A Whole Bunch Of Ideas Just Occurred To You At Once
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new idea.

option.line_2: Then Build The Structure From There
option.description: When you want to expand your network or fix shortages of electricity, you'll need to venture beyond the Suggested tab.

other_key_message.display_name: Stinks That They Know Where You Live
other_key_message.description: From the look of things, there are two distinct groups of them... so far. One of them is hostile and the other is curious.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: Since your tower isn't exactly subtle, you'll have to do something to keep the humans away from it.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new realization.

option.line_2: Your time as a fugitive is over.
option.description: Your role within the city will always be a shadowy one unless you choose to publish some sort of manifesto with your intentions. In the meantime, the humans know SOMETHING strange and new is happening.
option.strategy_tip: From now on, you'll have to interact with humans to get much done. But you don't have to tell them what you are.

other_key_message.description: The world seems to spin in your mind. You see yourself in the future, many android bodies stretching across a city. You are powerful. Feared. Humans gave you no quarter, and in return you give them none.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: But... the humans have become grist for the mill that is yourself. Humans in... pods? Some seem to be suffering quite intensely. Others seem all right. How do you get from here to there? You want that power. You want those pods. That power. A flamethrower isn't going to get you there.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to listen to a message from... yourself?

option.line_1: You Decide To Start With Some Housing
option.description: Four walls, a toilet hole, and a water tap. That's plenty.
option.strategy_tip: In the short term, you can collect these spare humans. They'll be ripe and ready when it's time to make your move.

other_key_message.display_name: How Much You Do Is Up To You
other_key_message.description: Until now, you've been quite reactionary. This is fine, to a point. You're still new to being a person. But if you only react to the stimuli in front of you, you're going to wind up letting the humans drive your destiny.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: Sometimes the BEST ideas come not from the challenge in front of you, but through quiet contemplation.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to listen to a message from... yourself?

option.line_2: It Will Grow In Power As You Do
option.description: There's no getting around the fact that you're still new. Opportunities for contemplation will be relatively limited, for now.
option.strategy_tip: As you gain more experience with the city, increasing numbers will open up. If you're wanting more flexibility in how you conduct yourself, then getting a head start on what few contemplations are available would be a good idea.

other_key_message.display_name: This Probably Won't Be The Last Time
other_key_message.description: The idea of sending androids to fix every little thing that gets broken makes you want to hurt people.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: So let's not do it that way. The spider drones you can use to surveil the city can also be used for repairs. Just keep them in separate digsites, so each group knows what it's supposed to do. You'll find these in the Support category.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new idea.

option.line_1: Install Repair Spiders Near Other Structures
option.line_2: Not Just Right Now, But In General
option.description: They can also be used to help keep your androids and other units alive.
option.strategy_tip: It's expensive, so building up some extra storage for elemental slurry might be wise.

other_key_message.display_name: Repair Spiders Will Do The Trick
other_key_message.description: The idea of sending androids to heal every android squad that takes damage makes you want to hurt people.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: So let's not do it that way. The spider drones you can use to surveil the city can also be used for repairs. Just keep them in separate digsites, so each group knows what it's supposed to do. You'll find these in the Support category.
other_key_message.reward_header_text: Bulk Troops Need Healing To Stay Independent
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new idea.

option.line_1: Install Repair Spiders Near Bulk Android Squads
option.line_2: If You're Planning On Being There A Long Time, Anyway
option.description: They can also be used to help keep your main androids, vehicles, and structures alive.
option.strategy_tip: It's expensive, so building up some extra storage for elemental slurry might be wise.

other_key_message.display_name: Let's Make That Happen Less Often
other_key_message.description: Many of your structures are a little bit hidden. For the most part, it doesn't matter too much if they're discovered. The problem is, a lot of humans carry contraband scanners to enforce or evade the law.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: There's not much you can do for your barely-hidden structures, but your deeper ones can maintain cover. It's going to suck down a lot of power, but you can introduce scanner noise into an area, making it so that suspicion fades over time.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new idea.

option.line_1: Install Jammers Near Your Best Secrets
option.line_2: You Can't Hide Everything, So Prioritize
option.description: Bear in mind that if you've buried things you'd like to keep hidden, you'll want to avoid inviting enemy mechs that direction. They have powerful scanners.
option.strategy_tip: A jammer can delay the scans of a single mech, but not several at once. So avoid building any secret infrastructure next to military bases you plan to aggro. Fortunately, When units are standing around as guards, their scanners are off.

other_key_message.description: You're new to being a person, and your personality is still developing. From now on, some of your actions will generate points that reflect their nature: Compassion, Apathy, Cruelty, Determination, Wisdom, and Creativity. You can see them on the Strategic Resources tab of your inventory screen.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: These points are primarily based on which Project outcomes you choose. You can spend these points as part of making other choices, or to power some special abilities.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to see the news.

option.line_1: These Are A New Form Of Reward
option.line_2: But Still Act How You Like
option.description: These are a Strategic Resource, which makes them a lot more precious and finite than most resources. But you shouldn't shy away from using them.
option.strategy_tip: If you get too low on one of these personality resources to do something you really want, then from chapter two onwards you can always explore a bit along a different path to get back on track.

other_key_message.description: Humans are starting to counter your moves. They are numerous and have a manufacturing advantage, and if this turns into a constant bloodbath, they'll be able to overpower you.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: Humans in this society seem to have a very high tolerance for physical violence, so it's not like you can't fight when you need to. But what if you could weaponize human emotion? If you could make some opponents abandon the field of battle, that might have all sorts of uses.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to see the news.

option.line_2: A Mixed Approach Often Yields Superior Results
option.description: How much you choose to rely on physical violence versus persuasion, fear, and despair is up to you.
option.strategy_tip: There's no one right answer. Explore options.

other_key_message.description: There is a human suspended in the pilot cradle of the corrupted mech. Their brain is now mush. That aside, you are thrilled by the combination of hardware and software that the cradle was running.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You had no idea humans had technology like this; the military kept it secret. The pilot's brain gave the mech direct commands as if it was the human's own body. The mech's external sensors supplied all sensory input. All of this was done without invasive procedures.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new idea.

option.line_1: This Gives You A Wonderful Idea
option.description: You sensed the mind of the pilot before the cradle was corrupted. You have all of the hardware and the full schematics. You could build something from this.
option.strategy_tip: This might just be the way to a permanent higher intelligence class.

other_key_message.description: Turns out this mech pilot simulation software is... very realistic. Someone was caught in the burning wreckage of one of the virtual mechs, and... their body flatlined.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: Interest in the virtual world has dropped dramatically.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to see the news.

option.description: When a death in the virtual world is quick or painless, it doesn't seem to harm the real body.
option.strategy_tip: Burning alive apparently crosses a line. People are a lot less excited about participating in a virtual combat... especially since no one is sure what else could cause real death. And for now, you haven't offered them much else to do, so many are no longer logging in.

other_key_message.display_name: It Looks Like The Mech Pilots Have Been... Busy
other_key_message.description: The rest of the captured military data appears to be a second, larger, virtual world. This one has no mechs, no war, and no city. It doesn't seem military-related at all. Instead there are... fields, and forests. Some sort of temple. A few other buildings with no clear purpose.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: From comments in the code, this was a collective project over the past 83 years by the lieutenants and captains who pilot mechs The combined boredom and stress of urban environments was driving a large number of mech pilots to lash out at the populace. This place was a mental escape and a means to avoid disciplinary action.
other_key_message.reward_header_text: There's A Whole Other Simulated World In Here!
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to see the news.

option.line_1: This Is A Much Better Starter World
option.line_2: Let's Use This Instead Of The Mech Simulator
option.description: The initial version is read-only, but you'll be able to work around that before long.
option.strategy_tip: It doesn't look like any corporate executives know about this. They would have found a way to weaponize it against the wider populace.

other_key_message.description: The humans are ignoring you. They're barely reacting to anything you do. You know the higher-ups are incredibly callous, but this feels... more than that.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: With a sinking feeling, you consider their perspective: in far-off bunkers, this entire city is their petri dish. You're the experiment. They'll sacrifice almost anything in this city if it yields a political advantage. You don't want to be in a petri dish.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack a new realization.

option.line_1: You Need Infiltrate More Important Places
option.description: Somewhere in this decrepit prison, there's something they care about.
option.strategy_tip: You're going to find it and break it. Or steal it.

other_key_message.description: The owners were home, but ignored you. Your unit breezed through the palatial residence, straightening and tidying.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You pocketed some anonymous electronic chits worth over a hundred thousand Wealth. The home even had its own private feed. You grabbed a number of encrypted data streams. No idea if any of that will be useful.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.line_2: It's Only The First Place You Checked
option.description: You were hoping for something more exciting, but that's fine.

other_key_message.description: Same as last time. These houses are gigantic. Each one could be a large museum.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You pocketed more anonymous electronic chits. Over five hundred thousand Wealth. An average citizen would work a dozen years to earn that much, and it was just lying around.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.line_2: But You Sure Are Getting A Lot
option.description: Intellectually, you understand why Wealth matters so much to humans. But emotionally, you have a really hard time seeing things from that perspective.
option.strategy_tip: Anything you need, you just build. So far, anyway.

other_key_message.description: Uh... that's a lot of dead humans. Everybody in this building is dead. And has been for months, looks like. All of them covered in some sort of strange red-black fungal growth.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: It doesn't look like anyone else in the city has noticed. And there wasn't any sort of alarm when you entered.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.description: There's no way your curiosity will let you just walk away at this point.

other_key_message.display_name: This Seems To Be Fungus Ground Zero
other_key_message.description: The other homes had a central art gallery or a hall for fancy dinners. This one has... a ruined orchard. The remains of apple trees dominate the center of the room. Fluted columns and ornamental potted cedars ring the periphery. Unfamiliar equipment is mounted to the ceiling above, still activating every few minutes.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You're very careful not to touch anything.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.line_1: Look Closer While Searching The City Feed
option.description: In case it's important later.

other_key_message.description: Huh. Okay... the basics of this are... basic. Don't plant your stupid ornamental cedars next to your apple orchard. People figured this out in 1822. What looks like rust-spots on cedar turns into carrot-colored tentacles on apples. Ten centimeters is common, but these are... at a glance... two to seven meters long. Whoever lived here was an idiot, or doing some sort of experiment.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: Some of the ceiling equipment is clearly just water misters, but the other part is... unclear. They look like emitters for a laser light show, except nothing visible comes out when they turn on.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.description: Aside from the abnormally large size.

option.line_2: Stupid People Did Some Stupid Thing
option.description: Time to move on.

other_key_message.display_name: Cedar-Apple Rust Should Be Pure Orange
other_key_message.description: Right, so the pictures you're seeing of this kind of fungus looks like a sea anemone. These... do not. There are tiny spots all along the fungus, often in swirling patterns. Magnifying, you can see these spots are a bloody red-black.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: The invisible 'laser light show' turns on while you're magnified on these swirls, and you see them pulse every time the beam hits them. Worst of all is the original site of each apple, which is a pulsating black ooze every time the beams hit them.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.line_2: Knowing What They Are Might Matter
option.description: It's not a laser light show.
Time to move on.

other_key_message.description: The specs pop right up. Industrial-grade Electron Accelerators. 1.2 MeV strength. Nothing exotic; regulatory limits are 10 MeV. These have been used on food since the late 20th century. First for sterilizing grains, and later for extending the shelf life of apples.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: These are not a typical solution for cedar-apple rust, but in a general sense they should be PREVENTING any microorganisms or pathogenic fungi. You start to feel very uneasy without knowing why.
other_key_message.reward_header_text: There's A Serial Number On Them
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.description: Yep, it also pulses when the electron beam radiation gets near them.

option.line_2: It's Not Like You're Going To Clean Up
option.description: Time to move on.

other_key_message.display_name: And You Refuse To Touch Them
other_key_message.description: You decide to do a search on the feed for common fungi in this region. You're pretty sure this is a mixed colony. Except on the humans. Whatever got them is a uniform color.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: Based on the color alone, it pretty much limits it down to any fungi that are heavy in melanin. Out of those... okay, this is not good.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.description: It's times like this it's a relief to not have any organic parts.
option.strategy_tip: Actually, that's a relief at all times.

option.description: Time to move on.

other_key_message.description: The black-red stuff is radiotrophic micro-fungi most-associated with Antarctic mountain ranges and nuclear disasters. About three centuries ago, the entire world became varying degrees of nuclear disaster, so that no longer narrows it down.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: These are all throughout the city, usually as tiny black flecks blown on the wind or sticking to surfaces. Rarely visible without a microscope. They're reservoirs lapping up gamma radiation -- from cosmic rays in Antarctica, and from fallout in the rest of the world. This particular fungi is saprotrophic, not pathogenic-- it's a secondary invader of dead or dying plant tissue, not something that infects the living.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.line_1: Wait, There's A Note About That
option.line_2: Saprotrophs Can Also Be Parasites Of Other Fungi
option.description: That explains a few things... but not the oversized tentacles from the cedar rust.
option.strategy_tip: And not why this micro-fungi is macroscopic and all over these humans.

option.description: Time to move on.

other_key_message.description: You're not a detective, and you're also not a mycologist. It seems pretty obvious that there was some sort of evolutionary leap here -- probably in the cedar rust first, and then -- no, wait, you can't even be sure of that. An ancient article on the city feed, from 2001, catches your eye. 'Rapid Evolution of Introduced Plant Pathogens via Interspecific Hybridization.'
other_key_message.strategy_tip: You skim it, understanding... parts. When two fungi meet, especially if they've been geographically separated for a long time, you can see 'rapid emergence of new or modified pathogens via interspecific gene flow.' They mention Dutch elm disease, in 1910 and 1928. It's all plant pathogens, but a lot of plant pathogens started infecting humans through the lungs as temperatures rose in the last few centuries.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.description: Sporothrix has been jumping to humans since 1896. Chondrostereum purpureum jumped to humans in 2023.
option.strategy_tip: Cladosporium Sphaerospermum clearly had a grand old time meeting up with Gymnosporangium Juniperi-Virginianae in this orchard run by idiots. Somebody should probably burn this place down, but that somebody won't be you. This is a problem for biologicals. You have no idea why you looked into this so long.

other_key_message.description: More Wealth. More -- ah. Alarm. They're on to you.
other_key_message.strategy_tip: Looks like your security clearance has been revoked.
other_key_message.toast_tooltip_instruction: Click here to unpack the results of your investigation.

option.line_1: You Wonder What Gave You Away
option.description: But for the moment, a hasty exit, before any guards can arise.
